newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.AFRICA PORT SEES RECORD CONTAINER INFLOW IN OCT.
newsitem.headline: S.AFRICA PORT SEES RECORD CONTAINER INFLOW IN OCT.

text.p: South Africa's Indian Ocean Durban port handled a record 75,141 cargo containers last month -- the highest ever since the terminal was set up 19 years ago, port authority Portnet said on Wednesday.
"We have just broken a record at our container terminal," Portnet spokeswoman Yvonne de Kock told Reuters.
"It's the first time that we have handled this number of containers since the terminal began operating in 1977," she said.
Portnet attributed the container influx to the pre-Christmas import boom.
Some 68,142 containers were handled at the port in October last year, she said.
